generated_body: The article is likely to discuss a proposal to repurpose a Navy weapons station in the Bay Area, which is currently home to WWII-era ammunition bunkers, into a large residential development comprising approximately 13,000 new homes. It may outline the implications of this transformation for local housing availability and urban development, including potential community responses and environmental considerations. The article could also explore the historical significance of the site, as well as the challenges and opportunities presented by such a large-scale redevelopment project.
